title: Natural Remedies for Nervousness
author: Simran
description: In this blog post, we will explore natural remedies for nervousness - what they are, how they work, and why they might be beneficial for you
cleaned_text: Feeling nervous can be a normal but unpleasant part of our lives. It's often associated with [anxiety](https://mantracare.org/counseling/anxiety/), [stress](https://mantracare.org/counseling/stress/), or even [depression](https://mantracare.org/counseling/depression/). Fortunately, many remedies can ease our nervousness and help us gain a sense of calm and balance. Natural solutions have been used since ancient times to alleviate the physical and mental symptoms of nervousness. In this blog post, we will explore natural remedies for nervousness - what they are, how they work, and why they might be beneficial for you Contents About Nervousness Nervousness is an emotion that most people will experience in particularly stressful or challenging situations. It is characterized by feelings of tension, worrying, and unease which can manifest physically as sweating, trembling, racing heart rate, difficulty concentrating, and increased alertness. While these physical symptoms can be uncomfortable and distracting, it's important to remember that nerves usually indicate that a person is interested, engaged, and invested in the task at hand. Nervousness can be helpful when it's viewed as a motivator or energizer that helps you to focus your energy and stay alert while taking risks or facing challenges. The impacts can be managed through [relaxation techniques](https://mantracare.org/therapy/stress/relaxation-techniques/), such as deep breathing and visualization, which can help put you in control of the situation. In times when nervousness becomes overwhelming or difficult to manage, it may be helpful to turn to a trusted friend or professional for support and further guidance. Natural Remedies Help with Nervousness If you are looking for natural remedies for nervousness, there are many options available. Some people find relief with herbal supplements, while others find that meditation or yoga helps them to relax. Here are a few natural methods that may help you to reduce nervousness: Herbal Supplements Some of the most common herbal supplements for helping with nervousness are kava, chamomile, lavender, and passionflower. These herbs have been used for centuries to help people who suffer from anxiety. When taken in proper doses, these herbs can help to relieve [fear](https://mantracare.org/therapy/what-is/fear/) and reduce stress levels. There are many herbal supplements for helping with nervousness, so it is important to speak with a medical professional before beginning any herbal supplement regimen. Meditation One of the most effective methods for reducing [stress and anxiety](https://mantracare.org/therapy/stress/stress-and-anxiety/) is meditation. Meditation helps to calm your mind, reduce stress and improve mental clarity. It also helps to increase self-awareness, focus on the present moment and connect with your inner self. Whether you choose guided meditation or practice [mindfulness](https://mantracare.org/therapy/meditation/mindfulness/) meditation, it's important to find a method that works for you. When you practice meditation regularly, you can become more aware of your thoughts and feelings, allowing you to better manage them. It also helps to keep your mind clear and centered, reducing the negative thought patterns that lead to stress and anxiety. There are several different styles of meditation, including mindfulness meditation, mantra meditation, body scan meditation, loving-kindness meditation, breath- [focused](https://mantracare.org/therapy/therapy-types/focused/) meditation, and more. Each style has its unique benefits and can help to reduce stress in different ways. It's important to find the style that works best for you and your needs. Exercise Exercise is a great way to relieve stress and anxiety. It helps by releasing [endorphins](https://mantracare.org/therapy/what-is/endorphins/), which improve your mood and make you feel more positive. Some types of [physical activity](https://mantracare.org/physiotherapy/treatment-tips/physical-activity/) that can help reduce stress and anxiety include: - Going for a walk or jog - Doing yoga or pilates - Weightlifting - Playing team sports - Participating in martial arts - Dancing - Swimming You don't have to become an athlete to benefit from exercise. Doing even a little bit of physical activity for only 10-15 minutes a day can help reduce stress and anxiety. It's important to find an activity that you enjoy and that fits into your lifestyle. Exercise doesn't have to be over complicated or time-consuming; it just has to get your heart rate up. Aromatherapy One natural remedy you may want to consider is [aromatherapy](https://mantracare.org/ayurveda/aromatherapy/). Aromatherapy uses essential oils to promote relaxation and ease anxiety. Lavender oil is one of the most popular essential oils for nervousness. It's been shown to reduce stress and anxiety in several studies. Research shows that lavender oil can also help improve [sleep](https://mantracare.org/therapy/sleep/sleep/) quality. Other essential oils that may help ease nervousness include chamomile, rose, and ylang-ylang. You can use these oils in a diffuser or add them to a bath or massage oil. If you're new to aromatherapy, start with a small bottle of lavender oil and see how it goes. Once you're comfortable using essential oils, you can experiment with different scents and combinations to see what works best for you. Acupuncture Another popular form of natural remedy for nervousness is [acupuncture](https://mantracare.org/physiotherapy/acupuncture/). Acupuncture is based on the traditional Chinese belief that a person's health is determined by their life force, or qi (pronounced "chee"), which flows through pathways in the body. This ancient practice involves inserting thin needles into specific points along these pathways to stimulate the flow of qi and improve overall health. Acupuncture is said to help reduce pain, improve mood and energy levels, and promote healing by stimulating the body's natural ability to regenerate itself. It may also be used to treat a variety of conditions such as headaches, allergies, [arthritis](https://mantracare.org/physiotherapy/arthritis/), digestive issues, stress-related illnesses, and even [addiction](https://mantracare.org/therapy/addiction/addiction-meaning/). Music Therapy Another way that music [therapy](https://mantracare.org/therapy/therapist/therapy/) can help people is by providing a source of comfort. Music can provide solace and peace to those who are going through difficult times or [feeling overwhelmed](https://mantracare.org/therapy/negative-feelings/feeling-overwhelmed/). Music also can evoke certain emotions, which can be beneficial in helping a person process and cope with difficult situations. Additionally, musical activities such as singing, playing instruments, and writing lyrics can be used to express oneself and one's emotions in a safe, healthy way. Music can also provide an outlet for [creativity](https://mantracare.org/therapy/what-is/creativity/) and creative problem-solving, further helping people cope with difficult situations. Journaling Another great way to process and express your emotions is through journaling. Journaling is a great creative outlet, as it allows you to get all of your thoughts and feelings out in an organized manner. You can start writing down whatever comes to mind—be it a rant, a list of things that inspire you, reflections on the day's events, or even just a reminder to yourself that everything is going to be okay. Writing your thoughts down can help you get perspective on what's causing stress and anxiety, process your emotions, and gain insight into your own life. If you're looking for further guidance on how to begin journaling, there are plenty of helpful resources online, such as a free journaling course or various books on the topic. Move Outside Another great way to relax is to spend some time outside. Getting away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life helps us to reset and recharge. Go for a walk, sit in your backyard, or take a day trip somewhere beautiful. Nature has a calming energy that can help reduce stress levels and bring you back into balance. Connecting with nature through activities like bird watching, gardening, hiking or exploring can be a great way to relax and appreciate the beauty of the world around you. Taking some time alone in nature will help clear your mind and give you perspective on any challenges you may be facing. So get out there and take advantage of all that nature has to offer. Vitamin-D Another key benefit of vitamin D is to keep your stress levels in check. Vitamin D helps regulate the hormone known as cortisol, which is released in times of stress and can cause anxiety, fatigue, and difficulty sleeping. Getting enough vitamin D can help to reduce these symptoms and keep your energy levels balanced. The best way to get vitamin D is through sensible sun exposure since the body synthesizes its vitamin D when exposed to ultraviolet (UV) rays from the sun. Aim for at least 10-15 minutes of direct, unprotected sun exposure a few times each week. You can also get vitamin D from food sources such as salmon, tuna, eggs, and mushrooms. Conclusion Natural remedies for nervousness can be a great way to reduce anxiety. From spending time in nature, drinking calming herbal teas, and practicing relaxation techniques like yoga and meditation, there are many different ways to help relax your body and mind. Additionally, if you ever find yourself feeling overwhelmed by stress or [panic attacks](https://mantracare.org/therapy/issues/panic-attacks/), it's important to talk to a professional [therapist](https://mantracare.org/therapy/therapist/therapist/) or medical doctor who can help recommend specific treatments that may be beneficial for your individual needs.
